channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CXF-2065] Xerces validation of aegis mapping file fails with cvc-complex-type.3.2.2: Attribute 'name' is not allowed to appear in element 'property'
item.description:
My aegis mapping files doesn't work if xerces is on classpath.

See also: http://www.nabble.com/Xerces-validation-question-td16315446.html

org.apache.cxf.aegis.DatabindingException: Error initializing parameters for operation

{http://service.mydomain.tld/}

myOperation: Couldn't create type for property myProperty on class tld.mydomain.service.MyResult: cvc-complex-type.3.2.2: Attribute 'name' is not allowed to appear in element 'property'. at /tld/
mydomain/service/MyResult2.aegis.xml line 5 column 25. cvc-complex-type.3.2.2: Attribute 'name' is not allowed to appear in element 'property'. at /tld/
mydomain/service/MyResult2.aegis.xml line 5 column 25.

item.summary: Xerces validation of aegis mapping file fails with cvc-complex-type.3.2.2: Attribute 'name' is not allowed to appear in element 'property'

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Doesn't this look like a Xerces bug to you?

the property element refers to an attribute group that surely includes 'name'.

Dennis,

Can you try with the version I've attached? I think I see the problem, but I'm a bit frustrated in figuring out how to test my ideas.

--benson
I believe this has to do with the unwanted xs:anyAttributes in the aegis.xsd, which I've removed. I tried a test program that read a .aegis.xml file while validating with Xerces 2.9.1, and it worked.
Doesn't work with the latest SNAPSHOT. Will upload a testcase asap.
This is really very odd. I built a standalone app that validated a .aegis.xml with that version of Xerces, and it worked. I look forward to your test case.

Hmmm it also works in my minimal test case. There are about 140 jars on the classpath of my application. Maybe one of the other dependecies is influencing the validation. I'll try to sort it out later.
This sure is odd. It's hard to think of what some other thing could to make this fail.
